results.title: The Broken covenant (A)
results.creator_credit: BBC, ABC-TV (Australia) and David M. Thompson
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Encounters”.
Many of Australia’s urban Aborigines live in appalling physical conditions and are seen by some Australians as derelicts. But to Father Ted Kennedy, a Catholic priest who works in the inner-city suburb of Redfern, they still retain an essential quality of life missing in white society.

results.title: The British way of health
results.creator_credit: British Information Services and Richard Marquand
results.brief_description: Outlines the work of the British National Health Service through the eyes of Dr Stone, a London doctor practising in a traditional two-doctor family practice, Dr Gibson, one-time Chairman of the British Medical Association, now senior partner at Friarsgate Medical Centre and Mr Laing, Consultant Plastic Surgeon, who heads an ultra-modern hospital and research unit caring for burned patients.

results.title: The British policeman
results.creator_credit: R.H.R. Productions, British Information Services, Ronald H. Riley and David Cobham
results.brief_description: Duties of a Police Constable in the United Kingdom - his kindness, his firmness, and discretion in dealing with the routine as well as the dramatic duties he is sometimes called upon to perform. The services of the policeman to the community are many and the responsibilities of the public in co-operation with their guardians of law and order are illustrated.

results.title: The British monarchy
results.creator_credit: J. Arthur Rank Organisation, Gaumont-British Instructional, Frank Wells and Derek Mayne
results.brief_description: This film illustrates the function of limited constitutional monarchy in the present state of the British Commonwealth and Empire. The monarchy provides continuity and unity. The idea of continuity is presented by showing the historical development of the British monarchy, and something of the constitutional function of the sovereign. The idea of unity is shown by scenes illustrating the monarch’s public duties and their position in relation to other countries of the Commonwealth and Empire.
results.creator_credit_for_label: J. Arthur Rank Organisation, Gaumont-British Instructional, Frank Wells and Derek Mayne

results.title: The British isles: the land and the people
results.brief_description: Brief scenes of typical industrial, farming, and seafaring activities in the British Isles; the geographical and commercial influences of these activities; views of coastline, countryside, parks, towns, mines and factories.

results.title: The British Commonwealth of Nations
results.brief_description: A survey of the historical and economic factors on which the Commonwealth was built; the trading companies, the missionary movement, empire builders, the freeing of colonial governments, provide a background for an understanding of the Commonwealth. Analyses the political, social and economic interests and ties which have held the nations together and its importance on world history.
